module.exports = "# æ–­ç‚¹\n\n<p class=\"description\">API that enables the use of breakpoints in a wide variety of contexts.</p>\n\nä¸ºäº†è·å¾—æœ€ä½³çš„ç”¨æˆ·ä½“éªŒï¼Œmaterial design çš„æ¥å£éœ€è¦åœ¨å„ç§æ–­ç‚¹èŒƒå›´ä¸‹è‡ªé€‚åº”å¸ƒå±€éœ€è¦ã€‚ Material-UI ä½¿ç”¨äº†åŸå…ˆ [specification](https://material.io/design/layout/responsive-layout-grid.html#breakpoints) çš„ **ç®€åŒ–** å®ç°ã€‚\n\næ¯ä¸ªæ–­ç‚¹ï¼ˆä¸€ä¸ªé”®ï¼‰åŒ¹é…ä¸€ä¸ª*å›ºå®š*çš„å±å¹•å®½åº¦ï¼ˆä¸€ä¸ªå€¼ï¼‰ï¼š\n\n- ** xsï¼Œ ** è¶…å°ï¼š0px\n- ** smï¼Œ **å°ï¼š600px\n- ** mdï¼Œ **ä¸­ç­‰ï¼š960px\n- ** lgï¼Œ **å¤§ï¼š1280px\n- ** xlï¼Œ **è¶…å¤§ï¼š1920px\n\nThese [breakpoint values](/customization/default-theme/?expand-path=$.breakpoints.values) are used to determine breakpoint ranges. æ¯ä¸ªèŒƒå›´åŒ…å«èµ·å§‹æ–­ç‚¹ï¼Œä¸åŒ…å«ç»ˆæ­¢æ–­ç‚¹ã€‚\n\n```js\nvalue         |0px     600px    960px    1280px   1920px\nkey           |xs      sm       md       lg       xl\nscreen width  |--------|--------|--------|--------|-------->\nrange         |   xs   |   sm   |   md   |   lg   |   xl\n```\n\nè¿™äº›å€¼å¯ä»¥è‡ªå®šä¹‰ã€‚ You will find them in the theme, in the [`breakpoints.values`](/customization/default-theme/?expand-path=$.breakpoints.values) object.\n\nè®¸å¤šç»„ä»¶å†…éƒ¨éƒ½ä½¿ç”¨äº†æ–­ç‚¹æ¥å®ç°å“åº”å¼è¦æ±‚ï¼ŒåŒæ—¶ä½ ä¹Ÿå¯ä»¥åˆ©ç”¨æ–­ç‚¹æ¥æ§åˆ¶åº”ç”¨çš„å¸ƒå±€ï¼Œè¿™å¯å€ŸåŠ©äº [Grid](/components/grid/) å’Œ [Hidden](/components/hidden/) ç»„ä»¶ã€‚\n\n## CSS åª’ä½“æŸ¥è¯¢\n\nCSS media queries are the idiomatic approach to make your UI responsive. The theme provides four styles helpers to do so:\n\n- [theme.breakpoints.up(key)](#theme-breakpoints-up-key-media-query)\n- [theme.breakpoints.down(key)](#theme-breakpoints-down-key-media-query)\n- [theme.breakpoints.only(key)](#theme-breakpoints-only-key-media-query)\n- [theme.breakpoints.between(start, end)](#theme-breakpoints-between-start-end-media-query)\n\nåœ¨ä¸‹é¢çš„æ¼”ç¤ºä¸­, æˆ‘ä»¬æ ¹æ®å±å¹•å®½åº¦æ›´æ”¹èƒŒæ™¯é¢œè‰² (çº¢è‰²ã€è“è‰²å’Œç»¿è‰²)ã€‚\n\n```jsx\nconst styles = theme => ({\n  root: {\n    padding: theme.spacing(1),\n    [theme.breakpoints.down('sm')]: {\n      backgroundColor: theme.palette.secondary.main,\n    },\n    [theme.breakpoints.up('md')]: {\n      backgroundColor: theme.palette.primary.main,\n    },\n    [theme.breakpoints.up('lg')]: {\n      backgroundColor: green[500],\n    },\n  },\n});\n```\n\n{{\"demo\": \"pages/customization/breakpoints/MediaQuery.js\"}}\n\n## JavaScriptåª’ä½“æŸ¥è¯¢\n\næœ‰æ—¶, ä½¿ç”¨ CSS æ˜¯ä¸å¤Ÿçš„ã€‚ æ‚¨å¯èƒ½å¸Œæœ›åŸºäº JavaScript ä¸­çš„æ–­ç‚¹å€¼æ›´æ”¹ React æ¸²æŸ“æ ‘ã€‚\n\n### useMediaQueryé’©å­\n\næ‚¨å¯ä»¥åœ¨ [userMediaQuery](/components/use-media-query/) é¡µé¢ä¸Šäº†è§£æ›´å¤šä¿¡æ¯ã€‚\n\n### withWidth()\n\n> âš ï¸ This higher-order component will be deprecated for the [useMediaQuery](/components/use-media-query/) hook.\n\n```jsx\nimport withWidth from '@material-ui/core/withWidth';\n\nfunction MyComponent(props) {\n  return <div>{`Current width: ${props.width}`}</div>;\n}\n\nexport default withWidth()(MyComponent);\n```\n\nåœ¨ä¸‹é¢çš„æ¼”ç¤ºä¸­ï¼Œæˆ‘ä»¬åŸºäºå±å¹•å®½åº¦æ›´æ”¹äº†æ¸²æŸ“çš„DOMå…ƒç´  (*em* ï¼Œ<u>u</u> ï¼Œ~~del~~ & span)ã€‚\n\n{{\"demo\": \"pages/customization/breakpoints/WithWidth.js\"}}\n\n## API\n\n### `theme.breakpoints.up(key) => media query`\n\n#### å‚æ•°\n\n1. `key` ï¼ˆ*String* | *Number* ï¼‰ï¼šæ–­ç‚¹é”®ï¼ˆ`xs` ï¼Œ`sm`ç­‰ç­‰ï¼‰æˆ–ä»¥åƒç´ ä¸ºå•ä½çš„å±å¹•å®½åº¦æ•°ã€‚\n\n#### è¿”å›ç»“æœ\n\n`media query`: A media query string ready to be used with most styling solutions, which matches screen widths greater than and including the screen size given by the breakpoint key.\n\n#### ä¾‹å­\n\n```js\nconst styles = theme => ({\n  root: {\n    backgroundColor: 'blue',\n    // Match [md, âˆ[\n    //       [960px, âˆ[\n    [theme.breakpoints.up('md')]: {\n      backgroundColor: 'red',\n    },\n  },\n});\n```\n\n### `theme.breakpoints.down(key) => media query`\n\n#### å‚æ•°\n\n1. `key` ï¼ˆ*String* | *Number* ï¼‰ï¼šæ–­ç‚¹é”®ï¼ˆ`xs` ï¼Œ`sm`ç­‰ç­‰ï¼‰æˆ–ä»¥åƒç´ ä¸ºå•ä½çš„å±å¹•å®½åº¦æ•°ã€‚\n\n#### è¿”å›ç»“æœ\n\n`media query`: A media query string ready to be used with most styling solutions, which matches screen widths less than and including the screen size given by the breakpoint key.\n\n#### ä¾‹å­\n\n```js\nconst styles = theme => ({\n  root: {\n    backgroundColor: 'blue',\n    // Match [0, md + 1[\n    //       [0, lg[\n    //       [0, 1280px[\n    [theme.breakpoints.down('md')]: {\n      backgroundColor: 'red',\n    },\n  },\n});\n```\n\n### `theme.breakpoints.only(key) => media query`\n\n#### å‚æ•°\n\n1. `key` ï¼ˆ*String*ï¼‰ï¼šæ–­ç‚¹é”®ï¼ˆ`xs` ï¼Œ`sm`ç­‰ï¼‰ã€‚\n\n#### è¿”å›ç»“æœ\n\n`media query`: A media query string ready to be used with most styling solutions, which matches screen widths including the screen size given by the breakpoint key.\n\n#### ä¾‹å­\n\n```js\nconst styles = theme => ({\n  root: {\n    backgroundColor: 'blue',\n    // Match [md, md + 1[\n    //       [md, lg[\n    //       [960px, 1280px[\n    [theme.breakpoints.only('md')]: {\n      backgroundColor: 'red',\n    },\n  },\n});\n```\n\n### `theme.breakpoints.between(start, end) => media query`\n\n#### å‚æ•°\n\n1. `start` (*String*): A breakpoint key (`xs`, `sm`, etc.) or a screen width number in pixels.\n2. `end` (*String*): A breakpoint key (`xs`, `sm`, etc.) or a screen width number in pixels.\n\n#### è¿”å›ç»“æœ\n\n`media query`: A media query string ready to be used with most styling solutions, which matches screen widths greater than the screen size given by the breakpoint key in the first argument and less than the the screen size given by the breakpoint key in the second argument.\n\n#### ä¾‹å­\n\n```js\nconst styles = theme => ({\n  root: {\n    backgroundColor: 'blue',\n    // Match [sm, md + 1[\n    //       [sm, lg[\n    //       [600px, 1280px[\n    [theme.breakpoints.between('sm', 'md')]: {\n      backgroundColor: 'red',\n    },\n  },\n});\n```\n\n### `withWidth([options]) => higher-order component`\n\næ³¨å…¥`width`å±æ€§ã€‚ å®ƒä¸ä¼šä¿®æ”¹ä¼ é€’ç»™å®ƒçš„ç»„ä»¶ï¼›ç›¸åï¼Œå®ƒè¿”å›ä¸€ä¸ªæ–°ç»„ä»¶ã€‚ è¿™ä¸ª`width`æ–­ç‚¹å±æ€§ä¸å½“å‰å±å¹•å®½åº¦åŒ¹é…ã€‚ å®ƒå¯ä»¥æ˜¯ä»¥ä¸‹æ–­ç‚¹ä¹‹ä¸€ï¼š\n\n```ts\ntype Breakpoint = 'xs' | 'sm' | 'md' | 'lg' | 'xl';\n```\n\nä¸€äº›å¯èƒ½æœ‰è¶£çš„å®ç°ç»†èŠ‚ï¼š\n\n- å®ƒå°†è½¬å‘*é React çš„é™æ€* å±æ€§ï¼Œä»¥ä¾¿ HOC æ›´ \"é€æ˜\"ã€‚ ä¾‹å¦‚ï¼Œå®ƒå¯ç”¨äºå®šä¹‰ ` getInitialProps()` é™æ€æ–¹æ³• (next.js)ã€‚\n\n#### å‚æ•°\n\n1. `options` (*Object* [optional]): \n  - ` options.withTheme ` (*Boolean* [optional]): é»˜è®¤å€¼ä¸º `false`ã€‚ å°† ` theme ` å¯¹è±¡ä½œä¸ºå±æ€§æä¾›ç»™ç»„ä»¶ã€‚\n  - `options.noSSR` (*Boolean* [å¯é€‰çš„]): é»˜è®¤å€¼ä¸º`false`ã€‚ ä¸ºäº†æ‰§è¡ŒæœåŠ¡å™¨ç«¯å‘ˆç°åè°ƒï¼Œå®ƒéœ€è¦å‘ˆç°ä¸¤æ¬¡ã€‚ ç¬¬ä¸€æ¬¡æ²¡æœ‰ä»»ä½•ä¸œè¥¿ï¼Œç¬¬äºŒæ¬¡ä¸å­©å­ä»¬åœ¨ä¸€èµ·ã€‚ è¿™ç§åŒéæ¸²æŸ“å‘¨æœŸæœ‰ä¸€ä¸ªç¼ºç‚¹ã€‚ UIæ˜¾ç¤ºçš„æ—¶å€™å¯èƒ½ä¼šå‘ç”Ÿé—ªçƒï¼Œå¦‚æœä½ ä¸æ‰“ç®—ä½¿ç”¨SSRæœåŠ¡å™¨ç«¯æ¸²æŸ“ ä½ å¯ä»¥å°†å…¶è®¾ç½®ä¸º`true`æ¥é¿å…è¿™ç§æƒ…å†µå‘ç”Ÿ\n  - `options.initialWidth` ï¼ˆ*Breakpoint* [å¯é€‰çš„]ï¼‰ï¼š ä¸º`window.innerWidth`åœ¨æœåŠ¡å™¨ä¸Šä¸å¯ç”¨ï¼Œ æˆ‘ä»¬é»˜è®¤åœ¨ç¬¬ä¸€æ¬¡å®‰è£…æœŸé—´å‘ˆç°ç©ºç»„ä»¶ã€‚ You might want to use an heuristic to approximate the screen width of the client browser screen width. For instance, you could be using the user-agent or the client-hints. https://caniuse.com/#search=client%20hint, we also can set the initial width globally using [`custom properties`](/customization/globals/#default-props) on the theme. In order to set the initialWidth we need to pass a custom property with this shape:\n\n```js\nconst theme = createMuiTheme({\n  props: {\n    // withWidth component âš›ï¸\n    MuiWithWidth: {\n      // Initial width property\n      initialWidth: 'lg', // æ–­ç‚¹å…¨å±€è®¾ç½® ğŸŒ!\n    },\n  },\n});\n```\n\n- `options.resizeInterval` (*Number* [optional]): é»˜è®¤ä¸º166ï¼Œå¯¹åº”äº60 Hzçš„10å¸§ã€‚ Number of milliseconds to wait before responding to a screen resize event.\n\n#### è¿”å›ç»“æœ\n\n`higher-order component`ï¼šåº”ç”¨äºåŒ…è£…ç»„ä»¶ã€‚\n\n#### ä¾‹å­\n\n```jsx\nimport withWidth, { isWidthUp } from '@material-ui/core/withWidth';\n\nfunction MyComponent(props) {\n  if (isWidthUp('sm', props.width)) {\n    return <span />\n  }\n\n  return <div />;\n}\n\nexport default withWidth()(MyComponent);\n```\n\n## é»˜è®¤å€¼\n\nYou can explore the default values of the breakpoints using [the theme explorer](/customization/default-theme/?expand-path=$.breakpoints) or by opening the dev tools console on this page (`window.theme.breakpoints`)."
